FuncDef:
The preference command sets the priority value of a candidate PCE server.
The undo preference command restores the default priority value of a candidate PCE server.
By default, the priority value of each candidate is 0.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the priority value of a candidate PCE server. The greater the value, the higher the priority.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 7.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Multiple candidate servers can be specified for a single client. These candidate servers can be prioritized. A candidate server with the highest priority is selected to calculate paths. To set the priority value for a candidate server, run the preference command.
If no priority value is set, the default value 0 is used, indicating the lowest priority. If candidate servers have the same priority, the server with the smallest IP address is selected to calculate paths.
Prerequisites
Run the connect-server command to configure a candidate PCE server for the PCE client.
